definition: exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate

sentences.english: As often as I praised him for his hard work, he kept silent.
sentences.chinese: 每當我表揚他工作勤奮時，他總是默不做聲。

sentences.english: And especially praised Li Xiaohui little friend, let the other kids learn from her.
sentences.chinese: 並着重表揚了李小惠小朋友，讓其他小朋友向她學習。

sentences.english: I carefully prepared a second model class, finally got the recognition.
sentences.chinese: 但我精心準備了第二次示範課，這次終於得到了表揚。

sentences.english: You still love to be praised when you’ve done well.
sentences.chinese: 當你幹好某事後你仍然想被表揚。

sentences.english: Australian Liberal Democratic Party's President Huang Zhaoqiang met and praised Zhao for his philanthropic undertaking.
sentences.chinese: 澳洲自民黨主席黃肇強都接見並表揚了趙尚陽的善舉。

sentences.english: The Captain highly praises the puppet show and thanks Maria
sentences.chinese: 上校表揚木偶戲，並感謝瑪麗亞。

sentences.english: People always believe that self-criticism, self-recognition is not.
sentences.chinese: 自我批評總能讓人相信，自我表揚則不然。

sentences.english: Reward your child with plenty of praise and encouragment.
sentences.chinese: 要給予你的孩子許多的表揚。

sentences.english: Maradona also praised Javier Zanetti for his reaction to losing the captaincy .
sentences.chinese: 馬拉多納同樣表揚了扎內蒂失去隊長袖標之後的反應。

sentences.english: Be Generous with praise, Cautious with friends.
sentences.chinese: 要不吝於表揚，但要慎於批評。

sentences.english: Another clue is how the first two servants are praised.
sentences.chinese: 另一句線索是前兩個僕人是如何被表揚的。

sentences.english: He Ming was praised for helping an old man cross the street.
sentences.chinese: 何明因爲幫助一位老人過街而受到表揚。

sentences.english: Reteaches a procedure when necessary and praises to reinforce when appropriate.
sentences.chinese: 需要時再教程序，恰當時用表揚進行強化。

sentences.english: The second statement creates a sense of success and self-value.
sentences.chinese: 第二個表揚會讓孩子體會到成功和自我價值的實現。

sentences.english: His praise would only cart me worse.
sentences.chinese: 他的表揚只會讓我處境更糟。

sentences.english: They deserve our praise and thanks.
sentences.chinese: 他們值得我們的表揚和感謝。

definition: special glory/distinction/rare honor/one's laurels/it's a privilege (to meet you)
to promulgate/to send out/to issue/to grant or confer
to praise/to approve of/to show approval
to show concern and care for
